conclusion: Analyze the motion of the slider, including projectile motion from point B to point C and impact with rough horizontal ground at point D.
Height of the experimental platform above the ground is h = 0.53 m, circular arc radius R = 0.4 m, tangent to ground at point D.
Calculate height of point C above the ground: h_C = 0.53 - 0.4 * 0.6 = 0.29 m.
Horizontal distance between points B and C is x_{BC} = 0.9 m.
Projectile motion equations: horizontal motion x = v_{B_x} t, vertical motion y = v_{B_y} t - 0.5 g t^2.
Time of flight to reach point C: t = 0.9 / (v_B * 0.8) = 1.125 / v_B.
Vertical velocity at point C: v_y = 0.6 v_B - 11.025 / v_B.
Horizontal velocity remains constant during projectile motion: v_x = v_B * 0.8.
Angle of velocity at point C: tan Ï† = v_y / v_x.
